"Quadratic equations have the general form ax² + bx + c = 0, where a ≠ 0.

The Quadratic Formula: x =  rac{-b \pm \sqrt{b^{2} - 4ac}}{2a}.

- Derivation (pages 112‑113)
- Worked example 1 (page 114)
- Practice problems (pages 115‑118)

Key points: the discriminant (b²-4ac) determines the nature of the roots. If it is positive, there are two distinct real solutions; if zero, one real solution (a repeated root); if negative, two complex solutions.

These sections were used to create the practice set for Alex."
